column4: you'll have to build your own nvidia module now, since you're not able to use the one in linux-resricted-modules
with mandrake I just d/l the drivers from nvidia.com and the installer built a module automatically. Can I do that in ubunut?
that's not the best approach, no
ok so are there any guides then? Or can you help? =)
there are guides, but they're for the general case (most users don't need custom kernels)
ok, what are the downfalls of using the nvidia installer?
it won't be a .deb package, and hence not under package management
not a huge prob then is it?
well, if you run into trouble with it, it'll be unsupported, since it's not in ubuntu main or restricted
that guide doesnt say anything about compiling the modules yourself does it?
precisely, because few people need to
not even many ubuntu developers have the need to compile their own kernel.  Why did you need to?
i want to use this 500hz usb polling patch
you're best off installing nvidia-kernel-source, and reading the documentation that comes with it to build a module for your custom kernel
I just used the nvidia installer =) seems ok
used the nvidia installer because he built a custom kernel
don't put words in my mouth
